snippet: Mississippi has started to move away from long-term isolation for its prisoners. More states must end this ineffective, cruel and common form of punishment.
abstract: Editorial applauds Mississippi for having significantly reduced the number of prisoners in its prisons who are subjected to solitary confinement; urges other states to follow Mississippi's example and to work toward ending this ineffective and cruel form of punishment.
